result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Montrail Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments by 10/27/2015, or serve 5 days in the HOC, consecutive. Defendant to make regular monthly payments. Defendant may request an extension, if making payments, and court will grant.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Montrail Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  5 days HOC, consecutive.   Due & owing.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Certification of transcript and transcript of sentencing proceeding from July 27, 2015, received and filed.  (65 pages).  jbs
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Court GRANTS Defendant's request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs and surcharges of this action at the rate of at least $50.00 per month commencing on 11-02-2015. If any monthly payment is more than 10 days late, the alternative commitment takes effect. Order received, signed, and filed with court.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
PAYMENT PLAN REQUEST
ADMINISTRATIVE STAY ALLOWING DEFENDANT UNTIL  11-27-2015  TO PAY FINE AND COSTS, GRANTED.

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SENTENCING HEARING CONTINUED.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 21 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 21 days time served.  

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 10/27/2015, or serve 5 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant may request an extension, if making payments, and court will grant.


Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Hanna Kolberg.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 10/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Current Initiatives Counseling Services, received and filed.  aw
From Patrick Cudahy, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W Purnell appears by phone.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
NO FILE IN COURT. 
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant produced an diluted sample.  Defendant did drink alot of water before he was tested.  Defendant admonished.  Defefendant can not drink alot of water when being tested.  Defendant to continue to be tested on his next scheduled date with Justice Point.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing on 6/26/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/26/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State to provide defense with an offer in this case.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Dennis Murphy for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/1/14.
css

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court.  Hanna Kolberg for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Purnell appeared via telephone. Defense Counsel requests an adjournment for today's proceedings due to illness.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/26/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Purnell.  Defendant Brandon Montrail Morris in custody.  Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
